info.title: Open Test Framework API
info.description: A RESTful API used to communicate with the OTF test control unit.

A successful asynchronously executed test with asyncMode set to 'poll' returns an execution identifier
The identifier can be used as a parameter to the Test Execution Service to check the status of the executed test

asyncTopic.title: Execute the test synchronously or asynchronously..
asyncTopic.description: Ignored unless async is true, and asyncMode is DMaaP.

asyncMode.title: Set the asynchronous execution mode.
asyncMode.description: Ignored unless async is true. The poll mode will return an executionId that can be used to query the result of the executed test. DMaaP is currently unsupported.

testData.title: Use an existing test instance with different global test data.
testData.description: Overrides (not overwrites) the testData field for the requested execution. The overridden data will be preserved in the test execution result.

vthInput.title: Use an existing test instance with different inputs to your VTHs.
vthInput.description: Overrides (not overwrites) the vthInput field for the requested execution. The overridden data will be preserved in the test execution result.

ExecuteTestInstanceRequest.description: The model for a test instance execution request.

testInstanceName.title: Name the test instance
testInstanceName.description: The name must be unique among all test instances belonging to the same test definition.

testInstanceDescription.title: Describe the test instance being created
testInstanceDescription.description: Use this field to describe the functionality of the test instance
testInstanceDescription.example: This test instance does absolutely nothing!

testData.title: Set global variables
testData.description:
This field has read and write access by any task within the workflow.
See the example for more information

vthInput.title: Set virtual test head data
vthInput.description:
This field determines the data each VTH at the designated ServiceTask will receive.
See the example for more information
